page.title: 12CHANGES IN LOSSIEMOUTH.
page.content: Between 1953 and 1985,Lossiemouth has seen great changes.The decline in the fishing industry has caused the loss of many jobs.The closure of the railway station some years ago has caused most visitors to arrive by car or by coach tour. A new High School and a new Primary School have replaced an old Secondary School with a Primary Department attached to it. In 1985 people can watch television and make use of the many facilities at the Community Centre. We now have the advantages of refrigerators,freezers and convenience foods. In 1985, Ballroom Dancing has given way to Disco Dancing to"Pop"records. The shopping trade is gradually declining due to the building of large supermarkets in nearby {ELGIN}.
